name: Country Inn & Suites By Carlson, Ithaca

reviews.text: Friendly staff, super clean, best cancellation policy and great location near falls. Walking distance to a cool bakery and creamery, also an Italian takeout or dine in restaurant. It's quiet without a lot of road traffic. Don't miss Buttermilk falls (Elmira rd entrance) and Treman state park upper entrance and lower entrances.
reviews.title: So far, so good!

reviews.text: We found this Country Inn to be clean and comfortable. It was quiet. We visited on the occasion of an event at Cornell University, but it was not a busy time of year (late September). We had a room with two queen beds, and a separate "living room". Each had a telephone and a modern flat screen TV. The room had wireless (or wired) and it worked just fine. The air conditioner has a setting that allows the fan to remain on independent of the cooling, which helps to maintain the background sound at a constant level. A large bottle of water was provided with the room at no extra charge. There was a ironing board and an iron in the closet, a small refrigerator, a microwave and a good clock. There was a separate little closet to place articles like suitcases to get them out of the way.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable, plenty of space in suites, adequate breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast (we stayed two nights) consisted of a variety of cold cereals, yogurt, oatmeal, fruit, three types of juice, milk, coffee, tea, bread, other things like bagels, and a hot serving. One morning that was scrambled eggs and bacon (the eggs were likely from powder) and the other morning there was a cinnamon french toast. Each morning you could cook your own waffles from a prepared batter in an idiot-proof cooker that worked pretty well. Newspapers were available, but likely not enough for the whole set of guests.
reviews.title: Up the hill from Cornell

reviews.text: check-in and out were easy. Little candy pieces are available at the front desk and coffee and tea are available in the lobby all day. Cookies also appear from time to time.
reviews.title: Over priced trap for college visits

reviews.text: All in all a good place. Be sure to ask for the corporate rate if you are on some sort of official visit to a specific Cornell academic function that has been registered with the Inn.
reviews.title: Very clean and comfortable - close to Ithaca College, and Cornell too (but not cheap)
Nice Stay for a College Visit
reviews.text: Nice room with separate bedroom. Comfortable beds. Pullout sofa not comfortable. 2 big flat screen tv's. Good wifi, fridge, microwave. No mirror in the bedroom could use one. Shower pressure not great. Nice hot breakfast. Close to Cornell.

reviews.title: Tops for value
reviews.text: I've stayed here many times and find that Country Inn provides great value. The sitting area in each room and the availability of complimentary breakfast on the premises, combined with an always smiling staff make this my "go-to" stop in Ithaca.

reviews.title: Good Hotel for visiting Ithaca
reviews.text: We went to go visit Cornell University for our older daughter and this hotel was an added bonus. The endless supply of cookies and coffee in the lobby was great, but given that it was free, they were always running out. It's very new and clean inside. The pool and jacuzzi are small but nice. I can't picture a huge crowd decending upon the hotel anyway so maybe it's the right size. Tip - get to breakfast before 8 AM, because it's complimentary and being good-to-very good food, things run out quick and the staff is scrambling to refill everything. I felt bad for the hotel staff but they worked hard trying to keep up. The only criticism I would have is with the room design (kind of late to change that, unfortunately): the sink and mirror really need to outside the bath & toilet area, as with 4 people in the room things would have gone faster with the separation. Overall it was a great place for a great value, especially if you factor in the free breakfast into the price.

reviews.title: Nice, clean place to stay
reviews.text: I had business in Ithaca and had a 6 hour car ride to get there so I decided to go the day before and stay overnight. I chose this hotel based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor and the fact that the management seemed to be interested in the feedback. I got in around 11:30 pm and check-in was a snap. The clerk greeted me by name and I had my key and was on my way to my room in under 5 minutes. The lobby was very bright and clean as was the area out in front of the hotel. The room was fine and it was clean. I did find the walls were pretty thin as I could hear people in the morning but it didn't bother us. We went to the breakfast with about 10 minutes remaining and they were out of eggs. We didn't mind as there was a waffle maker available and plenty of bagels, cereal and fresh fruit still out. Check out was simple and the front desk people were polite and friendly. They didn't ask me how my stay was though and that surprised me. They would have received positive feedback from me!

reviews.title: So Many Problems!
reviews.text: The hotel is a few miles from Ithaca College and Cornell so I would think it would be a convenient place to stay if you were planning a college visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a regular room with refrigerator & microwave. Very clean, no smells. modern decor with bold red color scheme. Tea and coffee available in the lobby all day and night. decent Continental breakfast. less than 3 minute drive from upper entrance of Buttermilk Falls Park (with great hikes and lovely waterfalls). across the street from a gas station/mini mart with water and snacks. less than 5 minute drive from ithace commons. laundry, vending and ice facilites all functional. Comfortable beds (slept SO deeply). Would definitely stay here again and made me start to consider this chain for future travels.
reviews.title: Had everything we could ever want in an Ithaca hotel

reviews.text: The room we had was a spacious two queen size bed suite. The bedroom was cozy and the living area had a fold out sleeper which we did not use. The coffee maker was great in the room and I used it both mornings.
reviews.title: We would stay here again

reviews.text: The hot breakfast we had in the breakfast room was a real treat. It had many choices for breakfast. You could have waffles, eggs and ham, cereal, muffins, bagels, oatmeal, yogurt, apples, oranges etc.
reviews.title: Worst hotel experience ever, unfortunately
We Enjoyed Our Stay
reviews.text: The location was close to Ithaca and it took 10 minutes to drive into the city. We would definitely recommend staying here.
Unfortunately, planning to stay at this property turned out to be an horrific experience. I will say that the property looked very nice, but...
reviews.title: Very comfortable for our family
Does what it says it will...
reviews.text: A family of 6, we stayed in a suite which was dark but adequate. Air conditioning temperatures vary widely between bedroom and lounge (so if you're at the right temperature in the latter, your co-travellers will be under blankets). Clean little pool, and easy to find on route 98. Best feature is that it's right next to the Italian Carry Out which has very good pizzas. Oh, and the breakfast room is tiny - so on a busy morning get down early (or late).

reviews.title: Great hotel for visiting Ithaca College and Cornell University!
reviews.text: We were travelling with our daughter on a college search trip and chose this hotel for its location very close to Ithaca College. It was almost perfect. The one bedroom room was very spacious and clean. The complimentary breakfast was adequate. We stayed 2 nights and have really no complaints other than more fruit and healthy choices for breakfast, and the pool was small. Nevertheless, we will definitely stay here again if our daughter attends either school.

reviews.title: Very comfortable in every way, but a bit high for our budget.
reviews.text: We have stayed here three times now, visiting local relatives. who live nearby, so the somewhat out-of-town location was an advantage for us. We loved the suite set up. One of us could read while the other slept. The extras include a TV in each room, generous sized refrigerator, microwave, and coffee setup. The lobby also has coffee and cookies available all day. All was very clean. The bathroom allows plenty of space for dopp kits. Bed is comfortable. Front desk was very courteous. We did not have breakfast, opting to eat with our local family instead, but it looked like there were enough choices for all. My difficulty connecting to the wireless network on my iPad was quickly resolved by a quick tip from the front desk.

reviews.title: Awful
reviews.text: Hair on the bedspread, jacuzzi jets broken. Could not drain jacuzzi, because the drain pull didn't work. Finally the body lotion jar was almost empty; obviously recycled. EEWWW!

reviews.title: Newer hotel
reviews.text: I was happy with my choice to stay here the weekend of the Cornell Reunion. It is a newer hotel and simply because of that alone it is nice. The only places in ithaca that i maybe would prefer to stay would be HIlton Garden Inn and The Statler but those were both sold out.
